intro: Fimbristylis circumciliata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, thriving in moist to waterlogged soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters. Fimbristylis circumciliata plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
